Rboretum: Analysis and Visualization of Phylogenies and their Support¶

The Rboretum package for R provides a number of functions that allow users to:

  1. Easily compare topologies across datasets with:
  • Easy tip label conversion
  • multiPhylo summary tools
  • Tree trimming function that prunes datasets down to a common set of taxa
  1. Get summary statistics (e.g. %GC, %N, %Parsimony Informative, etc.) from multiple-sequence alignment data, directly in R (via Biopython + reticulate)
  2. Extract site-by-site allelic signal from MSA data, and convert it to node support information that can be tabulated and plotted onto trees.
  3. Plot custom phylogenetic trees with a wide range of options including:
  • Branch/tip coloring
  • Plot resizing
  • The addition of informative node labels
